title: What is Spider-Man's web fluid made of? Could it be made in real life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Almost certainly some varieties of bioengineered silk. Coincidentally, just this week I was listening to the first two episodes of the podcast “The Biology of Superheroes”[1] , which were devoted to precisely this question (broadly speaking, the first episode to “awesome facts about silk in nature” and second episode to “how close are we to being able to bioengineer silk the way that Spider-Man does?"). (To summarise a couple of hours of discussion, we can currently do all sorts of fascinating stuff with bioengineered silk, but probably not actually web shooters at this point). Footnotes[1] The Biology of Superheroes Podcast
